title: Farmers cautioned over hot weather conditions
body:
CATHERINE BWALYA, Choma

SOUTHERN Province and other parts of the country are expected to continue experiencing hot weather conditions until around March 17, which might disadvantage farmers whose crops still need rainfall.

Most parts of the region have noted hot patterns since last week.

Southern Province meteorologist Victor Bupe says the presence of tropical cyclone Freddy over the south-west Indian Ocean between Madagascar and Mozambique is responsible for the dry weather recorded over much of Zambia.

"Tropical cyclone Freddy, which has been the longest tropical system along the Mozambique channel, has been changing its strength and intensity as it traverses the channel, making landfall twice over Mozambique.

"Each time the tropical cyclone was trying to move in the extra-tropical [cold area], it has been blocked by the high pressure system from CLICK TO READ MORE
